text: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation Ltd. posted higher-than-expected profit aided by lower taxes and higher other income while margins expanded.Net profit for the country's largest oil explorer rose 32 percent to Rs 5,131 crore for the three-month period ending September, the company said on Saturday. This compared to Rs 4,641 crore estimated by analysts tracked by Bloomberg. Revenue fell 0.6 percent to Rs 18,965 crore on a sequential basis and missed the Rs 21,180 crore forecast. The profit growth was aided by a higher dividend income from its subsidiaries.Earnings before interest, tax, deprecation and amortisation rose 3.5 percent to Rs 9,136 crore, missing estimates. Operating margins expanded by 190 basis points to 48.3 percent on a sequential basis.The numbers may not seem to be in-line due to some extra expenditure during the quarter, said AK Srinivasan, director (finance) at ONGC told BloombergQuint in an interview. He expects better growth in the second half of the year companies to the quarter gone by. “We are hopeful of achieving our products targets,” he said.Net realisations remained stable as ONGC made $51.22 per barrel of crude oil, but lower-than the estimated $52.5. This was also lower than global benchmark Brent crude oil which averaged at $53.31 per barrel during the same quarter.
title: ONGC Says Expect Better Earnings Growth In Second Half Of  The Year
